intro: Lubinia lineariloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lubinia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Lubinia lineariloba is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
